other_tests.findings: Pathological examination showed a multifocal MTC, with the largest focus being 1.8 cm. Metastatic tumor was found in nine of 16 lymph nodes removed.
other_tests.changes_over_time: One month after surgery, the serum calcitonin level decreased to 38 pg/ml. Six months after thyroidectomy, the patientâ€™s unstimulated calcitonin level had risen to 66 pg/ml.

other_tests.findings: Pathology revealed a mature ganglioneuroma without evidence of pheochromocytoma.
Pathology revealed two microscopic foci of MTC, one in each lobe.
other_tests.changes_over_time: To date, the patient has had normal follow-up calcitonin and carcinoembryonic antigen levels and no ultrasonographic evidence of residual or recurrent MTC.

other_tests.date: Two and a half years after thyroidectomy
other_tests.findings: CT scan revealed a 4.0-cm, hypodense, nonenhancing mass anterior to the superior portion of the left kidney.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Eighteen months after resection of the ganglioneuroma, there has been no gross recurrence on CT imaging.
